about_the_game:
Basically I wanted to make something like Warlords Battlecry III but without the basebuilding, as I never found that particularly exciting. i.e. you

Choose on the map where you want to go, and once you're there
You hire troops with your gold or select those you already have in your retinue, I believe those that don't enter the map become fully rested.
OK then with the troops you enter a map, fulfil the maps objective and then claim the reward and gear and gold.
Once a troop member has enough XP they will increase a level, where they become fully healed and stronger, you can equip a member with some gear eg better weapon/armour or charm

Controlled with the mouse
and WASD (QE)

Each map has an objective, the objective is one of the following
  • Kill everyone
  • Peregrination
  • Fetch
  • Assassinate
  • Survive
  • Collect Stuff
  • Protection
  • Destroy
  • Guide

content_descriptors.notes:
Deaths of characters contain blood and gore FX.
There is also some swearing in the dialog

name: Asunder

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i3 or AMD Ryzen 3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon R9 285 / GeForce GTX 950
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

short_description: A RTS fantasy game (with pause). It didn't turn out to be as fun as I hoped but at least I used it as a testing ground for Asunder II.
